data.sentence: The word وَمَا comes from the root م ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to be high/lofty, raised, name, attribute. samawat - heights/heavens/rain, raining clouds. ismun - mark of identification by which one is recognised. It is a derivation of wsm (pl. asma). ism - stands for a distinguishing mark of a thing, sometimes said to signify its reality.
data.sentence: The word السَّمَاوَاتِ comes from the root س م و and is associated with the meanings: to be high/lofty, raised, name, attribute. samawat - heights/heavens/rain, raining clouds. ismun - mark of identification by which one is recognised. It is a derivation of wsm (pl. asma). ism - stands for a distinguishing mark of a thing, sometimes said to signify its reality.

data.meanings: To rotate, bring forth herbs abundantly. Land abundant, fruitful, productive, luxuriant with herbage. Place for alighting or abiding. To tarry, await, expect, be patient. "Earth, as opposed to heaven: and the ground, as meaning the surface of the earth, on which we tread, and sit, and lie". Good land. Remain, fixed, tarry in expectation [on the ground]. Heavy, slow, sluggish, inclining, or propending to the ground. Submissive. A carpet, anything that is spread. A tremor, vertigo arising from a relaxed state. Wood-fretter, termite.
data.sentence: The word وَالْأَرْضِ comes from the root ا ر ض and is associated with the meanings: To rotate, bring forth herbs abundantly. Land abundant, fruitful, productive, luxuriant with herbage. Place for alighting or abiding. To tarry, await, expect, be patient. "Earth, as opposed to heaven: and the ground, as meaning the surface of the earth, on which we tread, and sit, and lie". Good land. Remain, fixed, tarry in expectation [on the ground]. Heavy, slow, sluggish, inclining, or propending to the ground. Submissive. A carpet, anything that is spread. A tremor, vertigo arising from a relaxed state. Wood-fretter, termite.
The word هَلْ comes from the root ه ل and is associated with the meanings: is it ... ?

data.meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness
data.sentence: The word بَيْنَهُمَا comes from the root ب ي ن and is associated with the meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness

data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word تَعْلَمُ comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبُّ comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.sentence: The word فَاعْبُدْهُ comes from the root ع ب د and is associated with the meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.

data.meanings: to be high/lofty, raised, name, attribute. samawat - heights/heavens/rain, raining clouds. ismun - mark of identification by which one is recognised. It is a derivation of wsm (pl. asma). ism - stands for a distinguishing mark of a thing, sometimes said to signify its reality.
data.sentence: The word سَمِيًّا comes from the root س م و and is associated with the meanings: to be high/lofty, raised, name, attribute. samawat - heights/heavens/rain, raining clouds. ismun - mark of identification by which one is recognised. It is a derivation of wsm (pl. asma). ism - stands for a distinguishing mark of a thing, sometimes said to signify its reality.

data.meanings: to bind, be patient or constant, endure patiently, steadily adhere to reason and command, restrain from what reason and law forbid, restrain from manifesting grief, agitation and impatience. The word being the contrary of jaz'a (manifestation of grief and agitation).. . Sabar (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He bore with patience.. Sabaruu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They bore patiently, patiently preserved.. Sabartum (prf. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You patiently preserved.. Sabarnaa (imp. 1st. p.m. plu.): We patiently preserved.. Yasbir (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing. fuss.): He patiently preserves.. Tasbiru (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing. fuss.): You have patience.. Tasbiruuna/Tasbiruu (acc. /imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. juss.): You will patiently preserve.. . Nasbira imp. neg. 1st. p. plu. ): We will not at all remain content.. Nasbiranna (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We will surely endure patiently.. Isbir (prt. m. sing.): Preserve thou (in doing good); Bear patiently; Wait thou patiently.. Isbiruu (prt. in. plu.): Be patiently preserving.. Saabiruu (prt. m. plu. III): Strive to excel in being patiently preserving.. Istabir (prt. in. plu. sing.): Be steadfast.. Sabrun/Sabran (acc./ v. n.): Patience.. Saabiruun/ Saabiriin (acc. /act. pic. plu.): Those who are calm and steadfast.. Saabiratun (act. plc. f sing.): Preserving one f.. Saabiraat (act. plc. f. plu.): Preserving women.. Asbara (elative.) : How very enduring.. Sabaar (ints. sing.): Patiently preserving.. Saabiran (act. pic. m. sing. acc.): Patient.
data.sentence: The word وَاصْطَبِرْ comes from the root ص ب ر and is associated with the meanings: to bind, be patient or constant, endure patiently, steadily adhere to reason and command, restrain from what reason and law forbid, restrain from manifesting grief, agitation and impatience. The word being the contrary of jaz'a (manifestation of grief and agitation).. . Sabar (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He bore with patience.. Sabaruu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They bore patiently, patiently preserved.. Sabartum (prf. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You patiently preserved.. Sabarnaa (imp. 1st. p.m. plu.): We patiently preserved.. Yasbir (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing. fuss.): He patiently preserves.. Tasbiru (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing. fuss.): You have patience.. Tasbiruuna/Tasbiruu (acc. /imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. juss.): You will patiently preserve.. . Nasbira imp. neg. 1st. p. plu. ): We will not at all remain content.. Nasbiranna (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We will surely endure patiently.. Isbir (prt. m. sing.): Preserve thou (in doing good); Bear patiently; Wait thou patiently.. Isbiruu (prt. in. plu.): Be patiently preserving.. Saabiruu (prt. m. plu. III): Strive to excel in being patiently preserving.. Istabir (prt. in. plu. sing.): Be steadfast.. Sabrun/Sabran (acc./ v. n.): Patience.. Saabiruun/ Saabiriin (acc. /act. pic. plu.): Those who are calm and steadfast.. Saabiratun (act. plc. f sing.): Preserving one f.. Saabiraat (act. plc. f. plu.): Preserving women.. Asbara (elative.) : How very enduring.. Sabaar (ints. sing.): Patiently preserving.. Saabiran (act. pic. m. sing. acc.): Patient.
